title: Dragonflies
summaries: Dragonflies are small, rare critters which can be found on surface. When approached, they will fly a short distance up and away from the player.

Dragonflies can only spawn during the <linked>day</linked> when the <linked>wind</linked> speed is lower than 20 <abbr title="miles per hour" class="nowrap">mph</abbr>, with following restrictions: when the player is in a <linked>town</linked>, dragonflies can only spawn during <linked>rain</linked>; otherwise, they can only spawn when not raining. Furthermore, there must be at least one <linked>cattail</linked> within a 61Ã—41-tile rectangle area centered on the spawning tile. The dragonfly will spawn on the cattail instead of the original spawning tile. As a result, they are capable of spawning on screen. Black, Orange and Yellow variants can spawn at cattails near <linked>Sand Blocks</linked> (usually in <linked>Desert</linked>), whereas Blue, Green and Red variants can spawn at cattails near pure <linked>Grass</linked> or <linked>Mowed grass</linked> (usually in <linked>Forest</linked>). Note that this is determined by the original spawning tile, not the tile the cattail grows, e.g. a Red Dragonfly can spawn on a cattail growing on a Sand Block as long as there is a Grass tile nearby.
Dragonflies have only 5 <linked>health</linked> and no <linked>defense</linked>, and can be damaged by other enemies and players.

Dragonflies can be caught with any Bug Net to be carried around in the inventory and released later, or crafted into animated decorative furniture (Dragonfly Jars). Once crafted, the Dragonflies cannot be released again, unless the furniture item is de-crafted via Shimmer(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions).

Dragonflies can be spawned by the <linked>Dragonfly Statue</linked>, however statue-spawned critters cannot be caught with any Bug Net, and will disappear in a puff of smoke when the player attempts to do so.
There is a 1/400 (0.25%) chance for a Gold Dragonfly to spawn in place of an ordinary one.
